intro: Specularia speculum-veneris var. hirta, commonly known as the Venus' looking-glass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is characterized by its striking, silver-blue flowers that resemble small mirrors, hence its common name. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which are typical of the hirta variety. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in cultivation.
